item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Caps appears to have come loose during transport. While unloading package from trailer it fell from the rollers. This caused (2) 1G plastic bottles to come open and leak inside trailer. QA was notified, removed package in red lined tote to Hazmat cage for further processing utilizing all proper PPE. (Gloves and Goggles)

item.title: Report E-2024070550
item.description:
Report E-2024070550

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: DICKINSON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 16, 2024, a pallet of 1-gallon pails of paint related material tipped over during unloading and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel deployed granular absorbents and absorbent pads to the paint material impacted pavement and collected it with hand tools. All damaged product were containerized into eight (8) 55-gallon steel drums. Crews collected all spent absorbents and containerized them into three (3) 55-gallon steel drums for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070497
item.description:
Report E-2024070497

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 12, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was damaged and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: Package was found in QA damage area with grey paint on outside. Package was being shipped as a call tag. Inner boxes each have a limited quantity diamond but no hazard diamonds were found on outer box.

  • Description: PART TIME METRO SUPERVISOR NOTICED LEAKING PACKAGE ON METRO 3. STOPPED BELT AND NOTIFIED RMP. RMP TOOK PACKAGE TO DMP. SUPERVISORS THEN NOTIFIED HAZMAT RESPONDER/AUDITOR WHO DONNED PPE AND INSPECTED PACKAGE IN SPILL TOTE AND IDENTIFIED THE CONTENTS. ONCE IT WAS DETERMINED THAT CONTENTS WERE HAZARDOUS AND NO IDENTIFYING MARKINGS WERE ON CARTON, CONTACTED THE HMSC UNDER THE CAPACITY OF A HAZMAT AUDITOR AND REPORTED IT AS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT SHIPMENT.

item.title: Report E-2024070467
item.description:
Report E-2024070467

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LAB. ERTS dispatched DSC Environmental to assist with cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 7 x 20 area of the trailer floor and an 8 x 6 area of the concrete lot below due to a puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum, impacted absorbents, and cleanup debris were containerized into (2) 95-gallon poly drums. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report I-2024070014
item.description:
Report I-2024070014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 06:09 AM on 06/24/24 I recieved notification that the tank car had sloshed product (Substituted Phenol) from under the manway. The car was located in track 47 at our North Yard, the shipper was contacted and they elected to use our Haz-Mat Contractor M&M Protection LLC to respond. Upon arrival it was noted that all 8 swing bolts were less than tool tight and the gasket was worn. These issues were corrected by M&M, new gasket, swing bolts tighten in a star pattern with no more evidence of product leaking. The car was washed and all spillage/residue was remediated.

item.title: Report E-2024070419
item.description:
Report E-2024070419

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LFW experienced a UN1992 19122 Lacquer Thinner Fast release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 gallon of product released to a 3 x 3 area of the concrete dock floor. The release was due to the pail falling off of the pallet as a result of improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents and damaged pail were then collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024060043
item.description:
Report I-2024060043

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: T. S. EXPEDITING SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While unloading, one 2,450Ib tote was discovered leaking. Area was isolated and contractor was dispatched. GrayMar Environmental responded to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, GrayMar Environmental inspected the leaking tote and determined the cap was faulty, which resulted in the release of approximately 0.5 gallon of product. Free product released to trailer floor and dock at customer location. GrayMar Environmental used absorbent material and rags to wipe the area clean, and transferred the leaking tote into a recovery tote to be sent on to the consignee. One 55-gallon drum of spent absorbent and cleanup debris was generated during the cleanup. Product was contained to an impervious surface and did not impact soil or threaten to impact state waters. There were no injuries or exposures reported.
